item.title: How do I edit these?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Remember to never edit .class or compiled files. If you want to change the text or items in the shops, edit the unpackedshops.txt, then delete the packedshops, compile and run the server. It should have changed.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I edit these?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Try uncommenting the Pvp armors.
If that doesnt work, check for extra spaces at the end of the numbers(prices) and delete them.

Example: 5 995 true - Beefy Bill’s Supplies - 1931 30 1929 10 1937 10 2313 10 1887 10 590 10 1735 10 1951 10 1969 10 1949 10 9703 10 9704 10 9705 10 9706 30
^

Read full topic

item.title: How do I edit these?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Z-file searcher is CASE SENSITIVE. Always remember that.

Edit: The way Java works is, you write in the .java file. When you compile, those files are turned into .class files which the programming language reads, or better yet the Java platform on your computer. You never edit .class files, that’s for the system. Whatever you write in the .java files gets compiled after doing so into .class files.

The .java files you write are always in the src folder, known as the source which humans read, and then once compiled, the .class files go into the bin folder which the computer reads.
That’s pretty much it…

Read full topic

item.title: How do I edit these?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Bro, this isn’t even help what you’re posting. This is COMMON SENSE.

Now, I’m going to give you the answers to your problems so theirs less spam in this thread…

The friends list text: Client sided

Bank text: Server sided

Shop titles: Server sided (located in data folder)

Logout message crap or whatever: Client sided

Only thing I’m not telling you is the welcome message.
Good luck on your ‘development’.

Read full topic
